37806472.review:
[h1]Une petite expérience VR très sympathique[/h1]

Comme beaucoup d’autres "démos" de ce genre ici il n’y a rien d’exceptionnel, tout ce que l’on à faire c’est regarder autour de soi le spectacle que l’on nous propose pendant que l’on avance petit à petit sur des rails.

C’est plutôt jolie, coloré, et ma foi assez plaisant dans l’ensemble. Notre voyage est cependant assez court ( moins de 10 minutes ) mais on en ressort très satisfait. Mon seul reproche serait éventuellement certains effets de lumière peut être un peu trop brutal, qui par moment m’ont un peu fais mal aux yeux.

Au final Fantasynth est très sympa en plus d’être totalement gratuit. Si vous avez un casque VR et que vous chercher quelque chose de simple pour votre première fois, c’est le jeu parfait pour vous.

34500472.review:
This was a cool light show with a nice light EDM soundtrack. A pretty laid back and relaxing experience, a treat for the eyes. It's completely non-interactive, controllers need to apply (except you need to press something to start it). Beware that there is artificial locomotion in this, and while it's slow and steady, it could affect someone sensitive.

I have only one major complaint - the audio. It's an audio-visual experience, and while it nails the visual aspect, the audio doesn't feel right. The reason is that it's not anchored in virtual space, as you turn around the audio turns around with you just like when listening to a song on your phone. There is zero spitaial audio used in this demo, and it really breaks the immersion. Especially when there are big audio differences between the two stereo channels, which give a momentary feeling of spatial sound, but as soon as you turn your head you realize the audio isn't part of the scene, it's just glued to your ears. It feels like there's an amazing silent light show, and you happen to be listening to matching music on your headphone. It's a real shame - I hope the developers decide to switch from just playing a music track to placing the audio sources in the actual 3D scene so that it feels truly immersive.

34462005.review: This HAS to be one of the most underrated VR experiences. If you like electronic music or dazzling light shows and have a VR system, you need to play this!

This stands as a great example of how music visualizers could work in the vr-world, now we just need a single program to do all the visualizing.

33738581.review:
Great experience but there is a caveat......it crashes Steam when I run it. I can't exit and that means I can't play anything else, I have to completely quit out of Steam AND restart my PC otherwise Steam still thinks it's playing even though I kill all Steam/Vive related processes in Task Manager. 
As for the experience itself, well it starts off really dark and doesn't get going for a minute or so leaving you thinking 'is this it?'. I almost exited the first time thinking there wasn't much to it but stick around because it really gets going and it feels like you're at a rave on some alien planet, floating through this high tech wonderland. Really impressive visuals and a pretty cool tune that gets you dancing :-)
But please, look into the crashing issue guys because this is an app that I would show off to friends who have never used VR to show them how cool the technology is. I wouldn't want to have to restart my PC everytime a different friend wanted to share the experience because I know they will want to after seeing the reaction of my other friends :-)

33477787.review:
[h1]Pretty short, but also quite good.[/h1]

This is a free VR experience, and that might make one question the level of quality involved. Worry not, it's a well made experience, it runs flawlessly on my 1070 graphics card, and for the price, you can't go wrong.

The song is great, the animations are solid, it's overall a really cool little experience. There's no way to interact with anything, but that's really not the point. It's a VR music video, and a darn good one, at that. 

If you've got a VR headset, this one's worth the download, which happens to be around 500mb, so it downloads nice and quick. 

Totally recommended.

33109141.review:
Woooow, this experience gave me goosebumps, made me feel ecstatic about the possibility’s. This would be the tomorrowland festivals of the future, imagine a million souls floating together in shared experiences like this, minimal one hour of the most exquisite VR art shows and world’s best DJ’s coming together and everyone around the world can join the show.

This was amazing and this is going to get even more amazing in couple of years.
Currently the graphics on this are very nice but I would love to see it with way more pixels (maybe in Vive2?), also had some circular glare reflections on the fresnel lenses in the Vive because of the high contrast (use of the lights in the dark setting), but this has noting to do with the artists work, they did a fine job, I think this shows the artistic talents are here but the hardware needs refinement to do good to the expressions they are able to deliver, but we are slowly getting there.

After experiences like this I simply know VR/AR is going to get immensely popular, projecting this out to a future of sleek high dynamic range supper resolution glasses and one to one tracking to get a full body in there + social connection (be able to invite friends to this type of party’s), you simply know there would not be a soul that would not be blown away by the experiences.

33040701.review: Aww man that was beautiful. Truely one of the most artistic pieces of VR I've ever seen and I enjoyed it! Looks gorgeous, sounds catchy. I was bobbing along the whole time. My only criticism is what I feel is a missed opportunity. This would be absolutely perfect if there was some degree of interactivity in there. I wanted to dance during it. Perhaps if my motion controllers were one of those spikes that light up and I could swing them around like glowsticks that pulse and riddle to the beat.

I wasn't expecting much from this, but wow I was wrong. First of all, that is a great tune (Chez Nous by N'to) and you guys should really feature it as part of the title of this game (at least in-game). I am an avid electronic music listener all I can say is that this is truly fantastic! Very well conceived and executed!

I would describe the experience as a blend of a music visualizer and a regular music video. It is a choreographed visualizer built on a 3D scene.

I would love to see a collaboration with Virtual Desktop to create an add-on for music visualizer environments that could react to user content (I would totally pay for that).
